intro: Rhynchospora microcarpa var. remotiflora, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that contain tiny flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
